intro: Aethionema beyrichii, commonly known as the rock cress, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a low-growing perennial that typically thrives in rocky or gravelly soils. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink, often blooming in early spring. Its leaves are narrow and succulent, adapted to conserve water in arid conditions. Aethionema beyrichii is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in challenging environments.
